clinical_study.brief_title: Postoperative Analgesia After Low Frequency Electroacupuncture
clinical_study.official_title: Postoperative Analgesia After Low Frequency Electroacupuncture as Adjunctive Therapy in Inguinal Hernia Surgery With Abdominal Wall Mesh Reconstruction

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether electroacupuncture is a effective tool to the postoperative analgesia

detailed_description.textblock: The electroacupuncture is a known therapeutic modality with particular application to pain. In this study the investigators investigate the effect of electroacupuncture in condition of surgery, which is a particularly painful situation. The investigators will verify the postoperative analgesia, as patients will receive either electroacupuncture or placebo electroacupuncture.

primary_outcome.measure: Monitoring of pain with the Visual Analogue scale within the first 24 hours after surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24 hours after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Monitoring of pain with the Visual Analogue scale performed preoperatively and at 30, 90 min, 10 hours and 24 hours after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Control of anxiety with the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory within 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory performed preoperatively and at 30, 90 min, 10 hours and 24 hours after surgery

other_outcome.measure: Monitoring of pain with the use of an algometer within the first 24 hours after surgery
other_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24 hours after surgery
other_outcome.description: Monitoring of pain with the use of an algometer performed preoperatively and at 30, 90 min, 10 hours and 24 hours after surgery

arm_group.description: Electroacupuncture before and after surgery (40min and 60 min respectively) with frequency 2 Hz, and 'frequency scanning mode'. Placebo electroacupuncture, in which the needles are secured (without penetrating the skin) and connected to the electrical device, which is not functional.

intervention.description: Electrical stimulation device with frequency 2 Hz and 'frequency scanning mode'

study_pop.textblock: Patients in the Surgical Clinic with right or left inguinal hernia, residents of Thessaly, Greece.

criteria.textblock:
inclusion criteria:
- healthy male volunteers
- 18-75 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- bilateral or recurrent hernia
- significant cardiovascular, pulmonary, renal, hepatic, neurological disease
- psychiatric history
- use of opioids until the last month
- body mass index greater than 30
- treatment with beta-blockers
- aged over 75
- previous experience with acupuncture
- hypersensitivity to opioids
- pacemaker patient
- patients being treated with monoamine oxidase inhibitors and selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors.
